v.v: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
“Can a man be useful to God?
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty if you are righteous?
Is it because of your reverence for him that he rebukes you
Is not your wickedness great?
For you have demanded guarantee of a loan from your brother for no reason,
You have not given water to weary people to drink;
although you, a mighty man, possessed the earth,
You have sent widows away empty;
Therefore, snares are all around you,
There is darkness, so that you cannot see;
Is not God in the heights of heaven?
You say, ‘What does God know?
Thick clouds are a covering to him, so that he does not see us;
Will you keep the old way
those who were snatched away before their time,
those who said to God, ‘Depart from us’;
Yet he filled their houses with good things;
Righteous people see their fate and are glad;
They say, ‘Surely those who rose up against us are cut off;
Now agree with God and be at peace with him;
Receive, I beg you, instruction from his mouth;
If you return to the Almighty, you will be built up,
Lay your treasure down in the dust,
and the Almighty will be your treasure,
For then you will take pleasure in the Almighty;
You will make your prayer to him, and he will hear you;
You will also decree anything, and it will be confirmed for you;
God humbles a proud man,
He will rescue even the man who is not innocent;

v: Can a wise man be useful to him?
Is it gain to him if you make your ways blameless?
and takes you to judgment?
Is there no end to your iniquities?
and you have stripped away clothing from the naked.
you have withheld bread from hungry people
although you, an honored man, lived in it.
the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
and sudden fear troubles you.
an abundance of waters covers you.
Look at the height of the stars, how high they are!
Can he judge through the thick darkness?
he walks on the vault of heaven.’
that wicked men have walked—
those whose foundations have washed away like a river,
those who said, ‘What can the Almighty do to us?’
the plans of wicked people are far from me.
innocent people laugh them to scorn.
fire has consumed their possessions.’
in that way, good will come to you.
store up his words in your heart.
if you put unrighteousness far away from your tents.
the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks,
precious silver to you.
you will lift up your face to God.
you will pay your vows to him.
light will shine on your paths.
and he saves the one with lowered eyes.
who will be rescued through the cleanness of your hands.”
